metadata.title: CVE-2022-40897 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Python Packaging Authority (PyPA) setuptools before 65.5.1 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service via HTML in a crafted package orcustom PackageIndex page. There is a Regular Expression Denial of Service(ReDoS) in package_index.py.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40897` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pypy-pkg-resources - 20.7.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
pypy-setuptools - 20.7.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-pkg-resources - 20.7.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-setuptools - 20.7.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-pkg-resources - 20.7.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-setuptools - 20.7.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-setuptools package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20.7.0-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
python-pip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
